TryHandleCommand() TryHandleCommandLuthetus.Ide.RazorLib.Terminals.Models.ITerminalInteractive Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.Terminals.Models.ITerminalInteractiveTryHandleCommand
Task< TerminalCommandParsed?> Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.Terminals.Models.ITerminalInteractive.TryHandleCommand (TerminalCommandRequest terminalCommandRequest)
Some terminal commands will map to "interactive" commands that are meant to modify the shell session rather than to start a process.
Ex: 'cd ../..' is an "interactive" command, where as 'dotnet run' will start a process.
This method gives the ITerminalInteractive an opportunity to handle the command, before it is executed at a more general level.
Presumably, 'dotnet run ../MyProject.csproj' where there is a ".." in a path, would need to be taken by the ITerminalInteractive, and then modified to replace "../MyProject.csproj" with the result of traversing this relative path from the working directory path.
The final result would then be returned for the ITerminal to execute, "dotnet run C:/User/MyProject/MyProject.cs" if the working directory were to be "C:/User/MyProject/wwwroot/".
If null is returned, then the ITerminal should return (do nothing more).
Implemented in Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.Terminals.Models.TerminalInteractive.
